pullRequest.body:
Add `prod_image_of_disjoint` (and the `to_additive` version `sum_image_of_disjoint`) and `sUnion_disjiUnion`

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

### PR summary [f6e12afe04](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15294/commits/f6e12afe0471991f1d7137dd3c13541b85a4e23e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ prod_image_of_disjoint`
`+ sUnion_disjiUnion`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Is this more general lemma true?
```lean
/-- If the images only overlap where the value is 1, then the function can move inside the binder -/
lemma prod_image_of_pairwise [PartialOrder Î±] [OrderBot Î±] [DecidableEq Î±]
    {f : Î¹ â†’ Î±} {g : Î± â†’ Î²} {I : Finset Î¹}
    (hf_disj : (I : Set Î¹).Pairwise fun i j => f i = f j â†’ g (f i) = 1) :
    âˆ s in I.image f, g s = âˆ i in I, g (f i) := by
```
I think the order is sort of a distraction here. Your lemma then follows as
```lean
by
  refine prod_image_of_pairwise <| hf_disj.imp fun i j (hdisj : Disjoint _ _) hfij => ?_
  rw [â† hfij, disjoint_self] at hdisj
  rw [hdisj, hg_bot]
```

This seems okay to me now.

maintainer merge
Thanks! We can simplify at bit. There's definitely a missing `@[congr]` attribute.

This seems okay to me now.

maintainer merge

Is this more general lemma true?
```lean
/-- If the images only overlap where the value is 1, then the function can move inside the binder -/
lemma prod_image_of_pairwise [PartialOrder Î±] [OrderBot Î±] [DecidableEq Î±]
    {f : Î¹ â†’ Î±} {g : Î± â†’ Î²} {I : Finset Î¹}
    (hf_disj : (I : Set Î¹).Pairwise fun i j => f i = f j â†’ g (f i) = 1) :
    âˆ s in I.image f, g s = âˆ i in I, g (f i) := by
```
I think the order is sort of a distraction here. Your lemma then follows as
```lean
by
  refine prod_image_of_pairwise <| hf_disj.imp fun i j (hdisj : Disjoint _ _) hfij => ?_
  rw [â† hfij, disjoint_self] at hdisj
  rw [hdisj, hg_bot]
```

This works if you mark `Finset.filter_congr` with `@[congr]`; can you do that please?
```suggestion
    congr! with j hj
```

Here it's easier to use the `Set.PairwiseDisjoint` API.
```suggestion
    exact âŸ¨fun h â†¦ hf_disj.elim hj hnI (by simpa [h]), by congr!âŸ©
```
Could you add a docstring to this lemma (and to its additivized version)? I had to read it several times to understand what it means. Thanks!

That's a good point. While I didn't have too much trouble understanding the idea, it *did* take me some time to understand why `PairwiseDisjoint` is needed, so commenting on that would be especially useful (especially since we already have [Finset.prod_map](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/BigOperators/Group/Finset.html#Finset.prod_map), where this assumption is not necessary, since `Finset.map` uses an embedding but `Finset.image` doesn't). Note: we also have [Finset.prod_image](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/BigOperators/Group/Finset.html#Finset.prod_image), so distinguishing the hypothesis from that one could be valuable too.
`hf_disj` is a stronger assumption than you say here.

I think using the ambient `g` variable (but not also `f`) makes this lemma confusing
```suggestion
    {f : Î¹ â†’ Î±} {g : Î± â†’ Î²} {I : Finset Î¹} (hf_disj : (I : Set Î¹).PairwiseDisjoint f) (hg_bot : g âŠ¥ = 1) :
```

pullRequest.title: feat: two Finset lemmas
